TopicTitle: Conflict between Real Fuels and KER (dV readings)

Articles.Content:
I'm using both Kerbal Engineer and Real Fuels (latest versions, 1.0.18.0 and 10.6 respectively) and I have a bug, seemingly a conflict that occurs when launching rockets: when a stage is running, stage dV readout on KER drops to zero as long as I am burning even if my tanks are full; on the other side, when the stage is not activated or when the engines are not burning, dV readouts come back to normal.

There also seems to be a similar issue with stage mass (masses shown surprisingly low) and TWR and acceleration (same as dV).

I would like to know if this is a known issue, and/or if there is a fix available.

I'm using both mods installed manually, and Stockalike engine configs (v2.1.8) for Real Fuels.

Real Solar System v10.2 with 2048 textures

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement v3.1.4

Kerbal Alarm Clock v3.4.0.0

KSC Switcher v0.4

RealPlume v10.4.9 with Stock configs v0.7 and RFStockalike configs (never really knew how to install those, but it seems to work)

Smoke Screen v2.6.9.0

SpaceY 1.0.1

Stock Clamshell Fairings v1.0

Stock Bug Fix Modules v1.0.4c1

Trajectories v1.4.3

Transfer Window Planner v1.3.1.0

I'm using KSP v1.0.4 32bit for Windows

No screenshots for now, I will add some if asked. Same for a more detailed description, I will take the time to do one if I'm asked to.

I may also report the issue on the threads of both mods, depending on the issue (if cause is found).
